item.title: Coronavirus: I don't regret what I did, says Dominic Cummings
item.description: The PM's top aide says he "behaved reasonably" as he explains why he drove to Co Durham during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: All non-essential shops to reopen from 15 June - PM
item.description: Boris Johnson says all shops can reopen in England next month if they meet certain Covid-19 guidelines.

item.title: 'Virus could be here for year' so schools must open, says education secretary
item.description: But education secretary admits parents will be nervous about safety of children returning to school.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain to stop quarantining arrivals from 1 July
item.description: The country hopes to save the summer season but UK tourists face quarantine in their own country.

item.title: Teenage girl among two dead after Cornwall sea rescues
item.description: The girl was trapped under a boat while a man died after being pulled out of the sea off Cornwall.

item.title: Coronavirus: Weston General Hospital halts admissions
item.description: Weston General Hospital has a high number of Covid-19 cases and has temporarily stopped accepting new patients.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown leads to concerns for vulnerable youth
item.description: Warnings that children’s social services in England will face an increase in demand after lockdown.

item.title: Brian May says he was 'very near death' after a heart attack
item.description: The Queen guitarist says he was "shocked" to discover he needed surgery and was "very near death".

item.title: Birling Gap: Warning after visitors pictured walking near cliff edges
item.description: Photographs show people standing on the edge of chalk cliffs that are prone to collapse.

item.title: Prince Charles issues warning on the arts
item.description: The Prince says it is important that theatres and orchestras flourish after the coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hairdressers offer virtual appointments in lockdown
item.description: Salons are giving advice via video chat apps to help people style and colour their hair at home.

item.title: New Zealand's PM stayed calm during an earthquake on live TV
item.description: New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern carries on a live TV interview as an earthquake hits parliament.

item.title: Volkswagen loses landmark German 'dieselgate' case
item.description: A ruling in a German court could have implications for other VW motorists seeking compensation.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: What did he do during lockdown?
item.description: The UK PM's most senior adviser has responded to accusations that he broke lockdown rules - what did he say?

item.title: Dominic Cummings row: The families who stayed away in lockdown
item.description: Members of the public have expressed anger after the PM's chief adviser travelled to Durham in lockdown.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Full statement on lockdown row
item.description: The PM's chief adviser told a press conference he wanted to "clear up confusion" amid calls for him to resign.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on caring for children during lockdown?
item.description: A look at the guidance as Downing Street backs Dominic Cummings over his 260-mile lockdown trip.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Changes have been announced to guidelines in England on exercise and social distancing.

item.title: Lockdown update: All you need to know about new measures
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions in England?

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Could you have to pay your bank to save money?
item.description: As countries take extreme measures keep the economy afloat, could we see negative interest rates?

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work and is my data safe?
item.description: Millions in the UK will soon be asked to monitor who they have been near to combat coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: How safe are takeaways and supermarket deliveries?
item.description: If coronavirus can be transferred on to surfaces, what are the risks of buying food?

item.title: What's the risk on public transport?
item.description: Bus and train operators are reducing services and increasing cleaning.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: Can children catch and pass on coronavirus?
item.description: BBC's Health Correspondent Laura Foster explains what we know currently about how children are affected by the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where do governments borrow money?
item.description: How does it work when a government wants to borrow money, and when does it have to pay it back?

item.title: In pictures: UK heads outdoors for bank holiday sunshine
item.description: Beaches and beauty spots prove a draw for families and friends in the sunny weather as lockdown eases.

item.title: How Coronavirus lockdown made a 'Zoom boom' generation
item.description: Digital transformation has advanced two years in just two months, says Microsoft.

item.title: UK turns to delivery cream teas during lockdown
item.description: Sweet treat deliveries see a surge in interest during lockdown, search data suggests.

item.title: The South Korean Samsung protester living in the sky
item.description: Kim Yong-hee has spent nearly a year on a 20m traffic tower to protest against Samsung's zero-union policy.

item.title: Coronavirus: Americans flock to beaches on Memorial Day weekend
item.description: People are seen flouting restrictions on what is known in the US as the unofficial start of summer.

item.title: India coronavirus: The girl who cycled to save her father
item.description: Jyoti Kumari, 15, took an arduous journey to save her father from hunger during the lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown could ‘deal fatal blow’ to HIV in the UK
item.description: Lockdown has created a unique opportunity to cut HIV transmissions in the UK, says a major sexual health clinic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Creative solutions to social distancing
item.description: As some lockdown restrictions ease, countries are finding inventive ways to keep people safe in public spaces.

item.title: Coronavirus: How lockdown brought a village closer together
item.description: A huge volunteer effort has brought Piddlehinton's 500 residents closer together.

item.title: The Metro Manila priests fighting coronavirus with the cross
item.description: Catholic priests in Metro Manila are risking their lives to serve their poverty-stricken community.

item.title: Life-sized Crystal Palace Park dinosaur sculpture damaged
item.description: The Grade I-listed Megalosaurus statue has been in Crystal Palace Park since the Victorian era.

item.title: 'I left my campervan in Argentina'
item.description: Thousands of van-driving nomads were living the dream - until the coronavirus pandemic brought them to a sudden halt.

item.title: Capt Tom donations: What is the £33m actually being spent on?
item.description: The money raised is not being used to buy core equipment - instead it is being used in other ways.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Five ways Europe is easing lockdown
item.description: Jogging in a Madrid park, having a Czech beer, taking a Greek ferry - Europe is opening up more.

item.title: The man who sells 700 million sandwiches a year
item.description: Patrick Coveney, is the boss of the UK's largest sandwich maker of pre-packaged sandwiches.

item.title: Coronavirus: The unseen key workers keeping things going
item.description: Our toilets still flush and our homes still have power in lockdown thanks to these key workers.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Caribbean tourism struggles as visitors stay home
item.description: Tourism is vital to the Caribbean but visitors are absent amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Women's Super League & Women's Championship seasons ended immediately
item.description: The Women's Super League and Women's Championship seasons are ended immediately, but sporting outcomes are still to be decided.

item.title: Ighalo set for China return as Man Utd struggle to agree loan extension
item.description: Striker Odion Ighalo looks set to return to China when his loan deal expires on 31 May, with Manchester United struggling to agree an extension with Shanghai Shenhua.

item.title: 'The lads were buzzing to kick a ball about with their mates' - Championship resumes training
item.description: Captain Liam Cooper says Leeds' players were "buzzing" as Championship clubs were allowed to resume training on Monday.

item.title: 'Don't tell me you're a professional club when you pay 80 quid a week' - Strachan questions Scottish set-up
item.description: Former Scotland boss Gordon Strachan believes too many of the country's senior clubs are not professional enough.

item.title: Evander Holyfield open to Mike Tyson rematch for charity
item.description: Evander Holyfield tells BBC Radio 5 Live he would fight Mike Tyson again for charity - if his old adversary asks him.

item.title: Bayern Munich keep up their Bundesliga title push with a 5-2 win over Eintracht Frankfurt.
item.description: Bayern Munich maintain their Bundesliga title push with a 5-2 win over Eintracht Frankfurt, ahead of Tuesday's meeting with second-placed Borussia Dortmund.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Baffling' observations from the front line
item.description: Doctors on the front lines are observing things that they have never encountered before - and it's a challenge.
